page.title: 04HOUSING
page.content: In this area most of the houses are old houses which have been modernised. On the edge of the common the houses were originally squatters cottage, that means the people had to build the chimmney in order to have the right to stay there. They were built from uncut stones from the hill. Nowadays they have been built on and modernised or left to fall down. Other cottages have been modernised. At Doddington and Hopton Bank new houses have been built on land belonging to small farms. In Hopton village there are some new houses where business people who travel to Birmingham live. The biggest house is the old Manor House which is built in Georgian style. Most of the houses have mains electricity and water but they have their own sewage tank. .
